name: SimilarWeb
slogan: Global multi-device market intelligence to understand, track and grow your digital market share
description:
SimilarWeb is the pioneer of digital market intelligence, and the standard for understanding the digital world. Our platform provides customers with granular insights about every website and mobile app enabling visibility into digital behavior and letting businesses see what is actually happening with their competitors, their industry and throughout the digital world. We have thousands of paying customers worldwide and millions of users using our free platform every month. Our customers are some of the largest global brands in the world and including Walmart, AirBnb, adidas, DHL and eBay. 

SimilarWeb raised over $112 million and has over 400 employees in 8 offices around the world in NY, SF, London, Tel Aviv, Tokyo, Kiev, Paris, San Paulo. 

With the insights and the data we provide businesses, agencies, marketers and analysts can benchmark performance against competitors,  reveal competitors online strategy, discover new opportunities, identify emerging trends and understand consumer
marketTags: B2B · SaaS · Mobile · Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning

jobs.title: Accounts Receivable and Collections Specialist
jobs.description:
*As the most trusted platform for measuring online behavior, millions of people rely on SimilarWeb insights daily as the ground truth for their knowledge of the digital world. We empower anyone — from the curious individual to the enterprise business leader — to make smarter decisions by understanding why things happen across the digital ecosystem. Learn more at [www.similarweb.com](http://www.similarweb.com/).*

**As an Accounts Receivable and Collections Specialist at SimilarWeb you will:**

Be responsible for accurate and timely customer invoicing, regular maintenance of recurring billing accounts, and for the general integrity of customer data in our systems. This position also supports the GTM teams as well as Collection activities handling all special billing requirements and billing reconciliation issues as well as supplying customer documentation as needed.

**Responsibilities:**

- Process all Quotes/ Orders in a timely fashion. 
- Ensure that contracts and all documentation as well as approval process standards are being met per finance and Legal requirements.
- Reject any orders not meeting standards and communicate to GTM teams and other users what changes are needed to correctly process the order.
- Process internal requests for address changes, billing account changes, rate changes, account termination, account reactivation, recurring billing additions, etc.
- Ensure that all Sales Orders submitted before monthly cutoff are invoiced prior to month-end closing.
- Contribute to the team’s mission to improve data flows, optimizing our processes, and ensuring accounting output is accurate.
- Document, communicate, and update all billing department processes and procedures.

**What will I bring to the team?**

- Minimum 1-2 years of billing or administrative experience preferably in subscription billing.
- Proficiency with MS Windows Office Suite (advanced user of Excel preferred)
- Superb attention to detail and strong analytical abilities
- Excellent organizational, interpersonal, and communication skills
- Ability to work with the corporate office and to be self motivated
- Ability to learn quickly and keep up in an ever-changing environment
- High level of confidentiality, discretion, and professionalism
- Ability to produce well-written, professional documents (spreadsheets, email, etc)
- Ability to follow directions, meet strict deadlines, and work independently
- Ability and genuine desire to develop positive and productive working relationships with both internal and external customers  
- Relevant academic degree.
- Excellent English – written and spoken.
- Salesforce experience- a plus
- 3rd party billing system experience- a plus

**Why choose SimilarWeb?**

We believe that building a great product and a great company starts with finding amazing people and helping them grow and develop professionally and personally. At SimilarWeb, you’ll be surrounded by the most talented professionals and you’ll work across departments gaining skills and driving impact.

**Our Values:**

- **Data Driven: We believe data driven decisions are the key to success and we are evangelists for the power of digital insights**
- **Passionate:**  We care deeply about what we do, are accountable for our actions and are committed to helping each other
- **Excellence:**  It’s in our nature; and we work hard to make a difference
- **Winning Together:**  We know what it takes to build a great company and a great product and it begins with valuing each and every member of our team

**#LI-MK1**

jobs.title: Applied Researcher
jobs.description:
As the most trusted platform for measuring online behavior, millions of people rely on SimilarWeb insights daily as the ground truth for their knowledge of the digital world. We empower everyone— from the curious individual to the enterprise business leader — to make smarter decisions by understanding why things happen across the digital ecosystem. Learn more at [www.similarweb.com](http://www.similarweb.com/).

The company has raised over $112M and has over 500 employees across ten global offices.

SimilarWeb has been named one of[  CALCALIST'S TOP 50 STARTUPS 2019](https://www.calcalistech.com/ctech/articles/0,7340,L-3761770,00.html) and one of the[ 10 MOST DESIRABLE ISRAELI COMPANIES TO WORK FOR](https://blogs.timesofisrael.com/10-most-desirable-israeli-companies-to-work-for/). Similarweb is also ranked 8th in[ DUN’S BEST HIGH TECH COMPANIES TO WORK FOR IN ISRAEL](https://www.duns100.co.il/en/rating/High_Tech_Electronics_&_Computing/Best_High_Tech_companies_to_work_for_) in 2018, taking over companies such as Amazon, Mobileye, PayPal, eBay and more.

**What makes the SimilarWeb Research & Data Science teams awesome?**

- We love data! At SimilarWeb you have the opportunity to work on a petabyte scale!
- We are solving some really hard problems in ML & Deep Learning, Statistical Estimation, Classification, Multiple Instance Learning and Privacy Preserving ML.
- We work with cutting edge technologies - we often beta test the tech that other people will only discover next year!
- We invest in our researchers and data scientists growth, such as holding research periodic talks, participating in world class conferences, presenting in meetups and much more!

**A day to day as an Applied Researcher at SimilarWeb means...**

- As an Applied Researcher, you will work as a research owner on cross-functional teams, responsible for the delivery of new algorithmic solutions. 
- You should love analyzing, mining and doing crazy things with data, and be great at it!  
- You will apply cutting edge research and ML algorithms to the development of scalable AI solutions. 
- On a day to day some of your responsibilities will include:

  - Developing novel algorithms and investigating state of the art methodologies
  - Improving accuracy of the current algorithms in production
  - Taking an active part in research and implementation

**What will you bring to the team?**

As an ideal candidate you have a broad and deep background in machine learning, robust experience in applied research, a passion for solving hard problems at scale, a strong drive for learning about new technologies, and a desire to collaborate with other teams. You bring deep theoretical knowledge in different fields of ML, deep learning, probability theory and statistics. Last but not least, you are eager to make a real impact on a world class product!

 

**Basic Qualifications:**

-   PHD/ M.Sc. in Mathematics/Physics/Computer Science/Engineering or equivalent
-   At least 2 years of experience in one of the following fields: ML, signal processing, computer vision, NLP, etc.
-   Proven code development skills in at least one coding language used for ML research - R, Python, MATLAB, etc. 
-   Familiar with Java or other OOP language- An advantage

**Why choose SimilarWeb?**

We believe that building a great product and a great company starts with finding amazing people and helping them grow and develop professionally and personally. At SimilarWeb, you’ll be surrounded by innovative, passionate and creative people that are looking to drive real impact. We are proud to have over 400 talented and passionate professionals, and we strongly believe in winning together as a way of driving a successful business!  

**Our Values:**

- **Data Driven:** We believe data driven decisions are the key to success and we are evangelists for the power of digital insights
- **Passionate:** We care deeply about what we do, are accountable for our actions and are committed to helping each other
- **Excellence:** We believe in excellence as a mindset. It’s in our nature; and we work hard to make a difference
- **Winning Together** :We know what it takes to build a great company and a great product and it begins with valuing each and every member of our team and working together to reach new heights.

jobs.title: Business Strategy Intern
jobs.description:
- 6 months internship
- Full Time - 37.5 hours per week
- This is a paid internship

 

**So what is the SimilarWeb Sales Solution?**

The SimilarWeb Sales helps companies to find, win and retain more business faster using a consultative sales approach. Already loved by sales teams at Google, Facebook, PayPal, DHL and 13,000 other sales organisations, the [Sales Solution](https://www.similarweb.com/corp/solution/sales/) is a powerful suite of data utilising SimilarWeb’s unique market intelligence data to enable sales professionals to win their market. The sales solution team is responsible for the sales solution product including strategy, product development, marketing, sales and customer retention.

 As an essential team member supporting the Sales Solution Team, this position will be:

- Involved in providing research, content, insights and outreach for our new business and account expansion initiatives.
- A key driver of our account based marketing programme to grow our highest potential accounts.

In this role you will get exposure to the end to end customer life-cycle of a SaaS company.  

This role is an integral part to the growth of one of the Sales Solution, one of SimilarWeb’s flagship product lines.

 

**Essential Job Functions:**

- Marketing: Prepare content, organise events and track the success of key marketing campaigns.
- Business Development: identify target customer segments and build targeted lead lists to help our product scale.
- Sales: Put together customer facing sales material, give platform demonstrations and assist with enabling our sales teams to better sell the solution.
- Product Management: participate in road-map planning sessions, analyse product utilisation, and assist in the product launch process for new features.
- Strategy: Complete competitive analysis, market sizing activities and assist in preparing key leadership and board presentations.

 

  **Preferred Qualifications:**

- Must have strong verbal, writing and interpersonal communication skills.
- Ability to manage multiple projects at once.
- Ability to work within a team.
- Some experience within a SaaS company is advantageous, but more important is your motivation to grow your career within this exciting industry.
- Ability to work within a team.
- Experience with common desktop tools such as Google Sheets, Google Slides, MSFT Word, Excel, PowerPoint or equivalent tools. 
- SQL an advantage

 

**Our Values:**

- **Data Driven:**  We believe data driven decisions are the key to success and we are evangelists for the power of digital insights
- **Passionate:**  We care deeply about what we do, are accountable for our actions and are committed to helping each other
- **Excellence:**  It’s in our nature; and we work hard to make a difference
- **Winning Together:**  We know what it takes to build a great company and a great product and it begins with valuing each and every member of our team

jobs.title: Commission Analyst (Temporary Position)
jobs.description:
SimilarWeb is the pioneer of market intelligence and the standard for understanding the digital world. SimilarWeb provides granular insights about any website or app across all industries in every region enabling the world's biggest brands like Airbnb, Walmart, HSBC, eBay and adidas to create the strategies necessary to win market share. The company has raised over $112M and has nearly 400 employees across eight global offices. SimilarWeb has been named one of [INC.COM 15 ISRAELI STARTUPS TO WATCH IN 2017 ](http://www.inc.com/john-rampton/15-israeli-start-ups-to-watch-in-2017.html)and one of [BUSINESS INSIDER’S TOP 50 ENTERPRISE STARTUPS TO BET YOUR CAREER ON.](http://www.businessinsider.com/enterprise-startups-to-bet-on-in-2016-2015-11?op=0#/#similarweb-44)  But if we want to continue helping the world’s biggest brands reimagine what is possible online, we need talented and driven individuals who are looking for the chance to make a real and tangible impact. Does this sound like you?

**As a Commission Analyst you will:**

Serve as support for the execution of, development of, and analysis of SimilarWeb’s commission plans. Reporting to SimilarWeb’s Corporate Controller your first mission will be to develop an understanding of SimilarWeb's commission plans and supporting systems. Communication and cross departmental cohesion are vital in this position, and your work will be at a critical intersection of a variety of teams around the globe. Detail-oriented individuals with an innate curiosity for data analysis and business processes are sought out candidates for this role.

**Responsibilities:**

- Support and manage the commissioning process, start to finish, to ensure accurate and timely commission calculations and payments
- Maintaining accurate sales personnel records in the Company’s commission software
- Assisting with monthly, quarterly, and annual commissions forecasting and financial closes
- Proactively troubleshoot and identify issues and correct as needed
- Providing customer service support and developing key relationships with SimilarWeb’s Sales GTM organization
- Designing and Implementing commission policy plan changes and commission parameters for new products/roles
- Collaborating with other departments to ensure that inputs and assumptions included in the commissions calculations are accurate and reasonable
- Capturing best practices and lessons learned following each commissions cycle to feed continuous improvements in process, tools, communication, and training
- Executing ad hoc analysis and projects as needed to inform and influence management decision making 

**What will I bring to the team?**

- **1-3 years in accounting, finance, operations, HR analysis or a related field**
- BSc/BA in a quantitative field such asEconomics/Mathematics/Physics/Engineering
- Exemplary oral and written communication skills, in English and Hebrew
- Excellent knowledge in Excel with the ability to work fast on big databases
- Ability to manage a high volume of transactional activity calmly and effectively
- A drive to provide excellent customer service and process improvement
- Excellent time management and prioritization skills
- Focus on attention to detail and a continuous drive to improve
- Self-motivation and the ability to work in a fast paced, forward moving environment
- Excellent interpersonal skills
- Experience with Salesforce.com- An advantage
- Experience with commission plans - An advantage

**Why choose SimilarWeb?**

We believe that building a great product and a great company starts with finding amazing people and helping them grow and develop professionally and personally. At SimilarWeb, you’ll be surrounded by the most talented professionals and you’ll work across departments gaining skills and driving impact.

**Our Values:**

- **Data Driven: ** We believe data driven decisions are the key to success and we are evangelists for the power of digital insights
- **Passionate:**  We care deeply about what we do, are accountable for our actions and are committed to helping each other
- **Excellence:**  It’s in our nature; and we work hard to make a difference
- **Winning Together:**  We know what it takes to build a great company and a great product and it begins with valuing each and every member of our team

jobs.title: Data Scientist (Senior level)
jobs.description:
As the most trusted platform for measuring online behavior, millions of people rely on SimilarWeb insights daily as the ground truth for their knowledge of the digital world. We empower anyone — from the curious individual to the enterprise business leader — to make smarter decisions by understanding why things happen across the digital ecosystem. Learn more at [www.similarweb.com](http://www.similarweb.com/).

The company has raised over $112M and has over 500 employees across ten global offices.

SimilarWeb has been named one of[  CALCALIST'S TOP 50 STARTUPS 2019](https://www.calcalistech.com/ctech/articles/0,7340,L-3761770,00.html) and one of the [10 MOST DESIRABLE ISRAELI COMPANIES TO WORK FOR](https://blogs.timesofisrael.com/10-most-desirable-israeli-companies-to-work-for/). Similarweb is also ranked 8th in [DUN’S BEST HIGH TECH COMPANIES TO WORK FOR IN ISRAEL ](https://www.duns100.co.il/en/rating/High_Tech_Electronics_&_Computing/Best_High_Tech_companies_to_work_for_)in 2018, taking over companies such as Amazon, Mobileye, PayPal, eBay and more.

**What makes the SimilarWeb Research & Data Science teams awesome?**

- We love data! At SimilarWeb you have the opportunity to work on a petabyte scale!
- We are solving some really hard problems in ML & Deep Learning, Statistical Estimation, Classification, Multiple Instance Learning and Privacy Preserving ML.
- We work with cutting edge technologies - we often beta test the tech that other people will only discover next year!
- We invest in our researchers and data scientists growth, such as holding research periodic talks, participating in world class conferences, presenting in meetups and much more!

**A day to day as a Data Scientist (Senior Level) at SimilarWeb means..**

- As a Data Scientist you should love analyzing, mining and doing crazy things with data, and be great at it! Our team is the place where all your analytic skills will come into action.
- You will develop new machine & deep learning and statistical algorithms in a Big Data ecosystem. You will work together with other researchers and Big Data engineers and collaborate with Product Managers to achieve superior results.  
- On a day to day some of your responsibilities will include:
  - Building Machine Learning pipelines into production
  - Owning and improving the algorithm and data accuracy
  - Developing novel algorithms and investigating new technologies
  - Explore new data sources and methods supporting the accuracy of the algorithms

**What will I bring to the team?**

- Over 3 years of experience developing machine learning/image processing/NLP and similar algorithms **- Must**
- PHD/ M.Sc. in Computer Science/Mathematics/Physics or any other relevant field  **- Must**
- Experience with probability theory and statistics
- Experience with statistical and machine learning tools - R, Python, etc.
- Good coding skills
- Familiarity with SQL

**Why choose SimilarWeb?**

We believe that building a great product and a great company starts with finding amazing people and helping them grow and develop professionally and personally. At SimilarWeb, you’ll be surrounded by innovative, passionate and creative people that are looking to drive real impact. We are proud to have over 400 talented and passionate professionals, and we strongly believe in winning together as a way of driving a successful business!  

**Our Values:**

- **Data Driven:** We believe data driven decisions are the key to success and we are evangelists for the power of digital insights
- **Passionate:** We care deeply about what we do, are accountable for our actions and are committed to helping each other
- **Excellence:** We believe in excellence as a mindset. It’s in our nature; and we work hard to make a difference
- **Winning Together** :We know what it takes to build a great company and a great product and it begins with valuing each and every member of our team and working together to reach new heights.

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.description:
As the most trusted platform for measuring online behavior, millions of people rely on SimilarWeb insights daily as the ground truth for their knowledge of the digital world. We empower anyone — from the curious individual to the enterprise business leader — to make smarter decisions by understanding why things happen across the digital ecosystem. Learn more at [www.similarweb.com](http://www.similarweb.com/).

The company has raised over $112M and has over 500 employees across ten global offices.

SimilarWeb has been named one of[  CALCALIST'S TOP 50 STARTUPS 2019](https://www.calcalistech.com/ctech/articles/0,7340,L-3761770,00.html) and one of the [10 MOST DESIRABLE ISRAELI COMPANIES TO WORK FOR](https://blogs.timesofisrael.com/10-most-desirable-israeli-companies-to-work-for/). Similarweb is also ranked 8th in [DUN’S BEST HIGH TECH COMPANIES TO WORK FOR IN ISRAEL ](https://www.duns100.co.il/en/rating/High_Tech_Electronics_&_Computing/Best_High_Tech_companies_to_work_for_)in 2018, taking over companies such as Amazon, Mobileye, PayPal, eBay and more.

**What makes the SimilarWeb R&D team awesome?**

- High performance web serving layer, capable of providing analytics on hundreds of millions of pages and domains with sub-second latency
- Work with cutting edge technology - we often beta test the tech that other people will only discover next year!
- We want you to get better and help you set goals and conquer them

**A day to day as a DevOps Engineer at SimilarWeb means:**

DevOps is software engineer with passion for infrastructure, exploring new technologies, building applications and tools to help us move faster while preserving high quality while being an effective communicator and a team member.

**Your role will include:**

- Creating APIs and tools that will be used by 100+ engineers and have a direct impact on how SimilarWeb delivers software and data.
- Design, build and manage highly available, scalable and robust services.
- Manage thousands of servers and containers by automating infrastructure changes and deployments.
- Developing and maintaining our logging, monitoring and alerting stacks.
- Troubleshooting and mitigating production incidents as part of an on-call rotation alongside engineers from within all other R&D groups (and make sure we don't get the same alert twice)

**What will I bring to the team?**

- Experience in **developing** server side applications and tooling using Python/Ruby/Java/Node.js/Go.
- Vast experience with running a large scale operation.
- Deep understanding in Linux: troubleshooting, designing robust architectures and understanding the internals;
- Good understanding of Web Servers, Load Balancers, Caching Systems, Relational Databases, Networking, etc.
- Ability and willingness to say your opinion and back it up with hard facts. 

It’s a plus if you also have:

- Experience with configuration management tools such as Puppet, Chef, Ansible, Terraform, Packer, etc.
- Experience with Docker and container orchestration solutions such as Nomad, Kubernetes, Mesos or Swarm
- Experience building web-based and CLI tools.
- Experience with AWS.
- Familiarity with Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, HDFS, Airflow, HBase, etc.

**Why choose SimilarWeb?**

We believe that building a great product and a great company starts with finding amazing people and helping them grow and develop professionally and personally. At SimilarWeb, you’ll be surrounded by innovative, passionate and creative people that are looking to drive real impact. We are proud to have over 400 talented and passionate professionals, and we strongly believe in winning together as a way of driving a successful business!  

**Our Values:**

- **Data Driven:** We believe data driven decisions are the key to success and we are evangelists for the power of digital insights
- **Passionate:** We care deeply about what we do, are accountable for our actions and are committed to helping each other
- **Excellence:** We believe in excellence as a mindset. It’s in our nature; and we work hard to make a difference
- **Winning Together** :We know what it takes to build a great company and a great product and it begins with valuing each and every member of our team and working together to reach new heights.

jobs.title: Legal Counsel
jobs.description:
SimilarWeb is the pioneer of market intelligence and the standard for understanding the digital world. SimilarWeb provides granular insights about any website or app across all industries in every region enabling the world's biggest brands like Airbnb, Walmart, HSBC, eBay and Adidas to create the strategies necessary to win market share. The company has raised over $112M and has over 400 employees across nine global offices.

SimilarWeb has been named one of[  CALCALIST'S TOP 50 STARTUPS 2019](https://www.calcalistech.com/ctech/articles/0,7340,L-3761770,00.html) and one of the [10 MOST DESIRABLE ISRAELI COMPANIES TO WORK FOR](https://blogs.timesofisrael.com/10-most-desirable-israeli-companies-to-work-for/). Similarweb is also ranked 8th in [DUN’S BEST HIGH TECH COMPANIES TO WORK FOR IN ISRAEL ](https://www.duns100.co.il/en/rating/High_Tech_Electronics_&_Computing/Best_High_Tech_companies_to_work_for_)in 2018, taking over companies such as Amazon, Mobileye, PayPal, Ebay and more.

 

**As SimilarWeb’s Legal Counsel, you will:**

- Support a fast-paced SaaS business
- Provide practical, business-oriented legal advice, counsel and recommendations to sales professionals and other stakeholders on numerous legal and business issues
- Draft, review, negotiate and close commercial contracts, including license and services agreements, service orders, and related documents with customers, partners, resellers, data licensors and vendors
- Coordinate with other groups (Finance, Marketing, Security, IT and others) in commercial contracting matters to support Company policies and procedures
- Monitor and provide guidance on data privacy and other applicable laws and regulations, as part of SimilarWeb’s global compliance program
- Manage legal support related to acquisitions, including due diligence reviews and negotiations of purchase and sale agreements
- Provide advice on employment laws and practices
- Create and maintain standard templates, business processes and internal policies to help scale the business
- Interface with and manage support from outside counsel

**What will I bring to the team?**

- 5+ years of commercial law experience, including work in a large law firm or in-house in a technology company
- Ability to draft and close commercial agreements with minimal support from senior staff
- Strong organizational and interpersonal skills, including ability to work effectively within a globally distributed team and a fast-paced business environment
- Excellent written and oral communication skills
- _Native, mother-tongue English_
- 

The ideal candidate should be:

- Self-driven and highly motivated to contribute to the success of the company
- Comfortable dealing with a global customer base and interacting in a multicultural environment
- Able to communicate legal issues and solutions clearly and concisely

**Why choose SimilarWeb? **

We believe that building a great product and a great company starts with finding amazing people and helping them grow and develop professionally and personally. jobs.description:

The company has raised over $112M and has over 500 employees across ten global offices.

SimilarWeb has been named one of[  CALCALIST'S TOP 50 STARTUPS 2019](https://www.calcalistech.com/ctech/articles/0,7340,L-3761770,00.html) and one of the [10 MOST DESIRABLE ISRAELI COMPANIES TO WORK FOR](https://blogs.timesofisrael.com/10-most-desirable-israeli-companies-to-work-for/). **What makes the SimilarWeb R&D team awesome?**

- We love data! At SimilarWeb you have the opportunity to work with it on a petabyte scale!
- As part of the team you will support backend for our multi million client side panel across all platforms through our massive ingest pipeline in cloud (Big data starts with ingesting even bigger data. Our Node.js, Kinesis, Java, Python, Go pipeline is impressive!)
- We are solving some really complex problems with web server scale, algorithms on the client side, research of different OS’s and APIs, managing multi million users products and more.
- Work with cutting edge technology - we often beta test the tech that other people will only discover next year!
- We want you to get better and help you set goals and conquer them

**Responsibilities**

- Design, code and manage a large scale web server cluster written in Node.js & Java
- Take part in design & decision making processes of a multidisciplinary team on a large variety of technologies
- Design, extend and manage SDK distributed on millions of mobile devices (Objective C, Java, JavaScript)
- Research Android & iOS internals
- Contribute  to your team development velocity and release quality confidence.
- Perform code reviews, evaluate implementations and provide feedback about potential tool improvements

**Requirements**

jobs.title: Product Marketing Manager
jobs.description:
*Product Marketing Manager - Marketing Intelligence*

*As the most trusted platform for measuring online behavior, millions of people rely on SimilarWeb insights daily as the ground truth for their knowledge of the digital world. We empower anyone — from the curious individual to the enterprise business leader — to make smarter decisions by understanding why things happen across the digital ecosystem. Learn more at* [*www.similarweb.com*](http://www.similarweb.com/)*.*

**What does the SimilarWeb Product Marketing Team do?**

Our job is to demonstrate how SimilarWeb’s products solve the world's market intelligence problems -- from the tactical optimization of user acquisition to the epic transformation of your digital strategy, from the mundane benchmarking report to the monumental new market entry or product launch. We approach product marketing as a mission-critical opportunity to build a disruptive new market intelligence category, make our customers data-driven superheros, and ultimately let SimilarWeb’s actionable insights speak for themselves.

You will shape the voice and tell the story of our Marketing Intelligence product’s value. You will ensure the entire company speaks the same language when it comes to your product’s messaging and positioning. You will lead product launches from alpha to general release, ensure customer facing teams are trained and ready to sell, and effectively communicate to customers. You will closely collaborate with our product, solutions, marketing and sales teams to define, develop and execute product marketing strategies & plans. You will drive new sales and post-purchase engagement and retention initiatives for your products and help grow your user base.

**As a Product Marketing Manager at SimilarWeb: **

You will be expected to think and act both strategically and tactically: from the creation of plans, to hands on execution. You must be a self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity in an ever-changing environment, and pay careful attention to detail. You must have the ability to quickly formulate strategies and plans that are backed by data & storytelling and execute across many work functions simultaneously.

- Build a deep understanding of our Marketing Intelligence customers & their use cases and SimilarWeb’s value proposition to this audience 
- Dive into competitive analysis with research & monitoring to become the expert on our competitive environment
- Build the voice of the customer fact base on your product & use cases by conducting interviews, designing surveys, and creating customer feedback loops
- Build product positioning, messaging and strategy (based on market fact base and data analysis) as you launch products globally with a cross functional team of product managers, engineers, marketers, business managers, and salespeople
- Test the effectiveness and measure the impact of product marketing activities and campaigns
- Provide excellent enablement & training for the Sales teams to ensure they are equipped to sell your Marketing Intelligence product
- Ensure all product related content communicates the value of our platform in our customers’ language, including: sales collateral, newsletters, webinars, in-app messaging, web copy, product videos, case studies, blog posts, and more
- Work closely with: Solutions & Product on strategy, positioning, differentiation and product launch; Marketing on content & campaigns; Enablement on training; GTM on customer feedback and education 
- Win over customers and prospects with product advocacy. 

**What will I bring to the team?**

- At least 2+ years experience specifically in product marketing
- Strong background in online marketing & user acquisition space - such as SEO, PPC, Affiliate, Display, Marketing Analytics or Management
- 5+ years of work experience in one or more of the following: product marketing, management consulting, outbound product management, market research or strategy
- Experience in a fast paced SaaS or DaaS company 
- Captivating storytelling, superb communication & presentation skills
- Able to work independently & autonomously, focusing on key outcomes amidst competing priorities & tight deadlines 
- Team player, strong at facilitating alignment & building relationships across an organization
- Analytical thinker, excellent problem solving, planning and execution skills
- Motivated & hard working
- Ability to be flexible and adapt to change

  **Why choose SimilarWeb?**

We believe that building a great product and a great company starts with finding amazing people and helping them grow and develop professionally and personally. At SimilarWeb, you’ll be surrounded by the most talented professionals and you’ll work across departments gaining skills and driving impact.

**Our Values:**  

- **Data Driven:** We believe data driven decisions are the key to success and we are evangelists for the power of digital insights
- **Passionate:** We care deeply about what we do, are accountable for our actions and are committed to helping each other
- **Excellence:** It’s in our nature; and we work hard to make a difference
- **Winning Together:** We know what it takes to build a great company and a great product and it begins with valuing each and every member of our team

jobs.title: SDR Sales Development Representative - Brazil, Porto Alegre Office
jobs.description:
SimilarWeb is the pioneer of market intelligence and the standard for understanding the digital world. SimilarWeb provides granular insights about any website or app across all industries in every region enabling the world's biggest brands like Google, Microsoft, Samsung, Adidas, Airbnb and Booking.com to create the strategies necessary to win market share. SimilarWeb has been named one of Inc.com 15 Israeli Startups to Watch in 2017.

But if we want to continue helping the world’s biggest brands reimagine what is possible online, we need talented and driven individuals who are looking for the chance to make a real and tangible impact.

**As a Sales Development Representative at SimilarWeb:**

- You will be responsible for prospecting, qualifying and creating sales opportunities for SimilarWeb Brazil sales team
- You will be responsible for acquiring and possessing expert knowledge of all SimilarWeb solutions
- Proactively prospecting for new decision-making executive contacts at key prospect targets and diversifying prospect relationships with contacts at multiple levels
- Ultimately, you will represent the front line of the company’s sales and marketing efforts, playing an important role in growing the business by starting the sales process and helping set up the sales teams for success.
- Develop accurate documentation in CRM (Salesforce.com)

**What will I bring to the team?**

- Fluent English (spoken and written, mandatory), preferably having lived and studied in English-speaking countries
- Previous experience in a sales-related function in one or more of the following: digital agencies, consulting firms, digital publishers, B2B SaaS companies
- Overall understanding of current digital marketing including display advertising, SEO, SEM, Affiliates
- Excellent communication and presentation skills
- Strong ability to manage influence through persuasion, negotiation, and consensus-building
- Strong empathy for customers AND passion for revenue and growth
- High integrity, energy, and dedication; we are looking for uncommonly good professionals with a highly collaborative, value-driven, honest and direct approach
- Ethic, resilience, and maturity
- Commitment and fulfillment of what is combined
- Demonstrated desire for continuous learning and improvement
- Ability to work independently, as well as part of a team, on multiple cases
- Team player able to effectively interact with colleagues and business partners across the company
- Flexible during times of change
- Analytical and process-oriented mindset
- Close attention to detail
- Knowledge in Microsoft Excel, Microsoft PowerPoint, Google Sheets, and Google Slides

**Why choose SimilarWeb?**

- We believe that building a great product and a great company starts with finding amazing people and helping them grow and develop professionally and personally. At SimilarWeb, you’ll be surrounded by talented professionals and you’ll work across departments gaining skills and driving impact.
- Impact: We are changing the way decisions are made. We provide insights that help businesses understand the digital world, their market, and their competition. With our digital market intelligence businesses can put their own data into context and make real data-driven decisions.
- Talent: We bring together the industry’s brightest minds. We recruit only the most talented ambitious professionals who are eager to work hard, take chances and share ideas. Our passion, enthusiasm, and drive for success are why we win together.
- Opportunity: We’re expanding our global team rapidly while taking pride in developing our people and promoting from within.

**Our Values:**

- Data-Driven: We believe data-driven decisions are the key to success and we are evangelists for the power of digital insights
- Passionate: We care deeply about what we do, are accountable for our actions and are committed to helping each other
- Excellence: It’s in our nature, and we work hard to make a difference
- Winning Together: We know what it takes to build a great company and a great product and it begins with valuing each and every member of our team

  • Fluent English (spoken and written, mandatory), preferably having lived and studied in English-speaking countries
  • Previous experience in a sales-related function in one or more of the following: digital agencies, consulting firms, digital publishers, B2B SaaS companies
  • Overall understanding of current digital marketing including display advertising, SEO, SEM, Affiliates
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills
  • Strong ability to manage influence through persuasion, negotiation, and consensus-building
  • Strong empathy for customers AND passion for revenue and growth
  • High integrity, energy, and dedication; we are looking for uncommonly good professionals with a highly collaborative, value-driven, honest and direct approach
  • Ethic, resilience, and maturity
  • Commitment and fulfillment of what is combined
  • Demonstrated desire for continuous learning and improvement
  • Ability to work independently, as well as part of a team, on multiple cases
  • Team player able to effectively interact with colleagues and business partners across the company
  • Flexible during times of change
  • Analytical and process-oriented mindset
  • Close attention to detail
  • Knowledge in Microsoft Excel, Microsoft PowerPoint, Google Sheets, and Google Slides

Why choose SimilarWeb?

  • We believe that building a great product and a great company starts with finding amazing people and helping them grow and develop professionally and personally. At SimilarWeb, you’ll be surrounded by talented professionals and you’ll work across departments gaining skills and driving impact.
  • Impact: We are changing the way decisions are made. We provide insights that help businesses understand the digital world, their market, and their competition. With our digital market intelligence businesses can put their own data into context and make real data-driven decisions.
  • Talent: We bring together the industry’s brightest minds. We recruit only the most talented ambitious professionals who are eager to work hard, take chances and share ideas. Our passion, enthusiasm, and drive for success are why we win together.
  • Opportunity: We’re expanding our global team rapidly while taking pride in developing our people and promoting from within.

Our Values:

  • Data-Driven: We believe data-driven decisions are the key to success and we are evangelists for the power of digital insights
  • Passionate: We care deeply about what we do, are accountable for our actions and are committed to helping each other
  • Excellence: It’s in our nature, and we work hard to make a difference
  • Winning Together: We know what it takes to build a great company and a great product and it begins with valuing each and every member of our team

jobs.title: Sales Director, Enterprise
jobs.description:
As the most trusted platform for measuring online behaviour, millions of people rely on SimilarWeb insights daily as the ground truth for their knowledge of the digital world. We empower anyone — from the curious individual to the enterprise business leader — to make smarter decisions by understanding why things happen across the digital ecosystem.

As a Sales Director at SimilarWeb you will be responsible for building, managing and growing a world-class enterprise sales team. The team works with prospective clients to understand their business objectives and are able to effectively communicate the value proposition of SimilarWeb’s software-as-a-service (SaaS) platform.

In the Sales Director role, you will be responsible for hiring, training, coaching and managing a team of Enterprise Sales Managers in order to achieve their targets. As the Sales Director you will ensure the sales team has all the ongoing sales, product, operational training and resources needed to do their jobs effectively. You will also manage a team of Sales Development Representatives who are a lead generation team, strategically outreaching to potential new prospects, setting meetings and handing over to sales managers

 

**Responsibilities:**

- Build and manage a high performing enterprise sales team
- Achieve growth sales targets, expand client-base and optimise operational KPIs
- Recruit and on-board the sales team in collaboration with other departments in the company
- Provide the sales team with ongoing sales enrichment, product and industry training
- Conduct regular pipeline reviews to provide accurate forecasting visibility whilst identifying areas for improvement
- Ensure all work processes and flows are followed as established by the Executive Team
- Participate in strategic planning and contribute significantly to the team strategy 
- Maintain a positive work environment - drive a high pace high success environment
- Create the link between SDR output and the Sales Manager pipeline verticalisation

 

**What will I bring to the team?**  

- Proven successful SaaS sales management experience
- Strong sales background with a proven track record of consistently achieving targets
- Solid managerial and leadership skills
- Excellent communication skills at all levels of the business
- Experience building value based sales strategy and processes and executing on the plan
- Track record of building,  training and reporting for sales teams
- Metrics driven sales management experience

 

**What makes the SimilarWeb Enterprise Sales team awesome?**

 

- We love market intelligence! At SimilarWeb you have the opportunity to work with the world's biggest brands and offer a solution that has the power to have a huge impact on their business!
- As part of our global team you will work alongside the industry’s top talent where you will have the chance to not only learn but also grow professionally
- Work at the forefront of marketing technology and big data - where the product is constantly evolving and getting better and better with each new iteration

 

**Our Values:**

- **Data Driven: We believe data driven decisions are the key to success and we are evangelists for the power of digital insights**
- **Passionate:** We care deeply about what we do, are accountable for our actions and are committed to helping each other
- **Excellence:** It’s in our nature; and we work hard to make a difference
- **Winning Together:** We know what it takes to build a great company and a great product and it begins with valuing each and every member of our team

###### **#LI-MJ1**

jobs.title: Sales Enablement Manager
jobs.description:
SimilarWeb is the pioneer of market intelligence and the standard for understanding the digital world. SimilarWeb provides granular insights about any website or app across all industries in every region enabling the world's biggest brands like Airbnb, Walmart, HSBC, eBay and Adidas to create the strategies necessary to win market share. The company has raised over $112M and has over 400 employees across nine global offices.

SimilarWeb has been named one of[  Calcalist's Top 50 Startups 2019](https://www.calcalistech.com/ctech/articles/0,7340,L-3761770,00.html) and one of the [10 Most Desirable Israeli Companies to Work for](https://blogs.timesofisrael.com/10-most-desirable-israeli-companies-to-work-for/). Similarweb is also ranked 8th in [Dun’s best high tech companies to work for in Israel ](https://www.duns100.co.il/en/rating/High_Tech_Electronics_&_Computing/Best_High_Tech_companies_to_work_for_)in 2018, taking over companies such as Amazon, Mobileye, PayPal, Ebay and more.

#### **Opportunity:**

This role offers an exciting opportunity directly impact the future of our entire customer facing organization. As the Sales Enablement Manager you will ensure that our GTM reps globally possess value based selling skills, adopt and utilize world-class sales tools, and equipped with the right processes, collateral, and messaging in an efficient GTM organization.

#### This role will own the end to end development of new hires and the onboarding program for our Go-To-Market (GTM) teams and oversee curriculum design, facilitation, execution and  measurement and ensure that we train our teams to provide the best sales funnel and customer journey. Thus will ultimately directly contribute to the revenue achievements of our go-to-market organization. 

#### It is an exciting role as part of the Business Operations department with a tremendous amount of freedom to try new educational practices, anticipate the needs of the organization and implement programs at your own discretion.

#### **Responsibilities** : 

 

- **Design and develop training materials for our Go-To-Market (GTM) organization primarily delivered via our Learning Management System but in a variety of forms, including web conference, video, written, newsletters, and more.**

- Improve GTM reps efficiency through use and utilization of tools content & materials

 

  - Work with Business Operations analysts on Funnel optimization processes, certification programs and rep measurement.
  - Optimize ramp time by building end to end rep onboarding programs, content and measurement
  - Design, manage and coordinate training and education programs to ensure maximum rep knowledge and efficiency on Sales skills, SimilarWeb education and sales processes.
  - Manage & update the content repository to ensure that all information is easily and rapidly accessible when needed

 

- **Partner with Product, Marketing and Solutions organizations on internal processes and events, including our Annual Sales Summit**

- Share and align sales best practices between all global GTM teams

 

**Core Skills Requirements:**

 

- **Strong Project Management skills and ability to run a training program end to end - from design, to execution, measurement and iteration**

- Intellectual curiosity and desire to seek outside advice from external blogs, groups, networks on how to best and most effectively train sales organizations

- Self-starter - anticipate a knowledge or tools gap and close it without having to be asked or monitored

 

  - Familiarity with best in class sales tools - implementation, use cases and usability 

 

- **Ability to execute and follow through on projects with a drive towards excellence**

- Data driven and ability to attribute training programs with commercial metrics and sales performance

- Experience in or a degree in technical writing or education a plus

 

**Qualifications:**

- Bachelor’s degree in Instructional Design, Education, Communications, or a related field
- Minimum 2 years in technical training and course development
- At least one year of previous sales experience, particularly in outbounding, discovery, prospecting, forecast management and negotiation a must
- Intermediate knowledge of authoring tools including Adobe Captivate, Adobe Premiere Pro, Adobe Creative Suite to create and edit video-based multimedia learning content
- Knowledge of Learning Management System (Litmos Preferred)
- Visual design skills and ability to storyboard
- Familiar with learning theories and methodologies, instructional design models, and lesson and curriculum planning skills
- Proactive mindset to own and deliver on your domain of expertise
- Possess excellent organizational, time management and follow through skills
- Clear and accurate communicator (both verbal and written), as well as engaging presenter exhibiting excellent interpersonal skills. Ability to write effective copy, instructional text, audio, and video scripts

**Why choose SimilarWeb?**

We believe that building a great product and a great company starts with finding amazing people and helping them grow and develop professionally and personally. At SimilarWeb, you’ll be surrounded by innovative, passionate and creative people that are looking to drive real impact. We are proud to have over 400 talented and passionate professionals, and we strongly believe in winning together as a way of driving a successful business!  

**Our Values:**

- **Data Driven:** We believe data driven decisions are the key to success and we are evangelists for the power of digital insights
- **Passionate:** We care deeply about what we do, are accountable for our actions and are committed to helping each other
- **Excellence:** We believe in excellence as a mindset. It’s in our nature; and we work hard to make a difference
- **Winning Together** :We know what it takes to build a great company and a great product and it begins with valuing each and every member of our team and working together to reach new heights.

jobs.title: Sales Manager - Brazil, São Paulo Office
jobs.description:
SimilarWeb is the pioneer of market intelligence and the standard for understanding the digital world. SimilarWeb provides granular insights about any website or app across all industries in every region enabling the world's biggest brands like Google, Microsoft, Samsung, Adidas, Airbnb and Booking.com to create the strategies necessary to win market share. SimilarWeb has been named one of Inc.com 15 Israeli Startups to Watch in 2017.

But if we want to continue helping the world’s biggest brands reimagine what is possible online, we need talented and driven individuals who are looking for the chance to make a real and tangible impact.

**As a Sales Manager at SimilarWeb:**

- You will be expected to exceed monthly, quarterly and annual revenue goals by planning and executing successful sales, strategically selling the company’s solutions to new prospects in a consultative manner
- You will be responsible for acquiring and possessing expert knowledge of all SimilarWeb solutions
- Manage the entire sales cycle from prospecting, discovery, presentation, negotiating and closing
- Proactively prospecting for new decision-making executive contacts at key prospect targets and diversifying prospect relationships with contacts at multiple levels
- Execute key meetings and demonstrations, seminars, webinars, and on-site events
- Develop accurate forecasts and manage sales activity in CRM (Salesforce.com)

**What will I bring to the team?**

- Fluent English (spoken and written, mandatory), preferably having lived and studied in English-speaking countries
- A high performer with experience exceeding sales targets
- An established network of contacts
- 4+ years of experience in Sales in one or more of the following: digital agencies, consulting firms, digital publishers, B2B SaaS companies
- Ideally experience of taking a new, disruptive technology to market
- Deep understanding of current digital marketing including display advertising, SEO, SEM, Affiliates
- Deep understanding of the market research, consulting or marketing analytics landscape
- Excellent communication and presentation skills
- Experience in presenting to and interacting with senior management of prospect organizations
- Strong ability to manage influence through persuasion, negotiation, and consensus-building
- Strong empathy for customers AND passion for revenue and growth
- Proven ability to establish strong relationships with business intelligence, analytics, marketing, procurement/sourcing within target verticals
- High integrity, energy, and dedication; we are looking for uncommonly good professionals with a highly collaborative, value-driven, honest and direct approach
- Ethic, resilience, and maturity
- Commitment and fulfillment of what is combined
- Demonstrated desire for continuous learning and improvement
- Ability to work independently, as well as part of a team, on multiple cases
- Team player able to effectively interact with colleagues and business partners across the company
- Flexible during times of change
- Analytical and process-oriented mindset
- Close attention to detail
- Knowledge in Microsoft Excel, Microsoft PowerPoint, Google Sheets, and Google Slides

** Why choose SimilarWeb?**

- We believe that building a great product and a great company starts with finding amazing people and helping them grow and develop professionally and personally. At SimilarWeb, you’ll be surrounded by talented professionals and you’ll work across departments gaining skills and driving impact.
- Impact: We are changing the way decisions are made. We provide insights that help businesses understand the digital world, their market, and their competition. With our digital market intelligence businesses can put their own data into context and make real data-driven decisions.
- Talent: We bring together the industry’s brightest minds. We recruit only the most talented ambitious professionals who are eager to work hard, take chances and share ideas. Our passion, enthusiasm, and drive for success are why we win together.
- Opportunity: We’re expanding our global team rapidly while taking pride in developing our people and promoting from within.

**Our Values:**

- **Data-Driven:** We believe data-driven decisions are the key to success and we are evangelists for the power of digital insights
- **Passionate:** We care deeply about what we do, are accountable for our actions and are committed to helping each other
- **Excellence:** It’s in our nature, and we work hard to make a difference
- **Winning Together:** We know what it takes to build a great company and a great product and it begins with valuing each and every member of our team

  • High integrity, energy, and dedication; we are looking for uncommonly good professionals with a highly collaborative, value-driven, honest and direct approach
  • Ethic, resilience, and maturity
  • Commitment and fulfillment of what is combined
  • Demonstrated desire for continuous learning and improvement
  • Ability to work independently, as well as part of a team, on multiple cases
  • Team player able to effectively interact with colleagues and business partners across the company
  • Flexible during times of change
  • Analytical and process-oriented mindset
  • Close attention to detail
  • Knowledge in Microsoft Excel, Microsoft PowerPoint, Google Sheets, and Google Slides

** Why choose SimilarWeb?**

  • We believe that building a great product and a great company starts with finding amazing people and helping them grow and develop professionally and personally. At SimilarWeb, you’ll be surrounded by talented professionals and you’ll work across departments gaining skills and driving impact.
  • Impact: We are changing the way decisions are made. We provide insights that help businesses understand the digital world, their market, and their competition. With our digital market intelligence businesses can put their own data into context and make real data-driven decisions.
  • Talent: We bring together the industry’s brightest minds. We recruit only the most talented ambitious professionals who are eager to work hard, take chances and share ideas. Our passion, enthusiasm, and drive for success are why we win together.
  • Opportunity: We’re expanding our global team rapidly while taking pride in developing our people and promoting from within.

Our Values:

  • Data-Driven: We believe data-driven decisions are the key to success and we are evangelists for the power of digital insights
  • Passionate: We care deeply about what we do, are accountable for our actions and are committed to helping each other
  • Excellence: It’s in our nature, and we work hard to make a difference
  • Winning Together: We know what it takes to build a great company and a great product and it begins with valuing each and every member of our team

jobs.title: Solution Marketing Manager
jobs.description:
SimilarWeb is the pioneer of market intelligence and the standard for understanding the digital world. SimilarWeb provides granular insights about any website or app across all industries in every region enabling the world's biggest brands like Airbnb, Walmart, HSBC, eBay and Adidas to create the strategies necessary to win market share. The company has raised over $112M and has over 400 employees across nine global offices.

SimilarWeb has been named one of[  CALCALIST'S TOP 50 STARTUPS 2019](https://www.calcalistech.com/ctech/articles/0,7340,L-3761770,00.html) and one of the [10 MOST DESIRABLE ISRAELI COMPANIES TO WORK FOR](https://blogs.timesofisrael.com/10-most-desirable-israeli-companies-to-work-for/). Similarweb is also ranked 8th in [DUN’S BEST HIGH TECH COMPANIES TO WORK FOR IN ISRAEL ](https://www.duns100.co.il/en/rating/High_Tech_Electronics_&_Computing/Best_High_Tech_companies_to_work_for_)in 2018, taking over companies such as Amazon, Mobileye, PayPal, Ebay and more.

**We want you!**

We are seeking a data-driven marketing professional to lead and execute the marketing strategy for one of our solutions.

**Responsibilities:**

- Develop and implement short and long-term marketing strategies and campaigns in order to increase brand awareness, lead generation, and pipeline creation
- Build a marketing calendar, execute the campaigns and measure the impact
- Planning and management of marketing campaigns for all marketing purposes, including newsletters articles, blog post content, webinars, events, white papers,  videos, images, advertisements, and creatives
- Experiment with a variety of organic and paid acquisition distribution channels 
- Prepare and monitor the marketing budget on a quarterly and annual basis and allocate funds wisely
- Measure and report on the performance of marketing campaigns, gain insight and assess against goals
- Coordinating with the various teams and stakeholders

**Skills & Requirements:**

- At least 3 years experience in a marketing role in a SaaS B2B company - A must 
- Highly collaborative, partners well with others
- Ability to work effectively with senior leaders and other key stakeholders throughout the organization.
- Effective organizational skills with an ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment
- Proven experience in identifying target audiences and in creatively devising and leading across channels marketing campaigns that engage, educate and motivate
- Strategic thinker with the ability to build and execute a full marketing plan 
- Solid knowledge of tools (e.g. WordPress, Pardot, Google Analytics, Similarweb, Salesforce)
- Experience in running ABM campaigns is a plus
- Numerically literate, comfortable working with numbers, making sense of metrics and processing figures with spreadsheets
- Up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in online marketing and measurement

**Why choose SimilarWeb?**

We believe that building a great product and a great company starts with finding amazing people and helping them grow and develop professionally and personally. At SimilarWeb, you’ll be surrounded by innovative, passionate and creative people that are looking to drive real impact. We are proud to have over 400 talented and passionate professionals, and we strongly believe in winning together as a way of driving a successful business!  

**Our Values:**

- **Data Driven: ** We believe data driven decisions are the key to success and we are evangelists for the power of digital insights
- **Passionate:**  We care deeply about what we do, are accountable for our actions and are committed to helping each other
- **Excellence:**  We believe in excellence as a mindset. It’s in our nature; and we work hard to make a difference
- **Winning Together** :We know what it takes to build a great company and a great product and it begins with valuing each and every member of our team and working together to reach new heights.
